original_solution_mapping.L1: On the third day, there were one-third of the number of bedbugs as the fourth day, so there were 810 / 3 = <<810/3=270>>270 bedbugs.
original_solution_mapping.L2: On the second day, there were one-third of the third day's bedbugs, so there were 270 / 3 = <<270/3=90>>90 bedbugs.
original_solution_mapping.L3: On the first day, there were 90 / 3 = <<90/3=30>>30 bedbugs in the group to start with.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3588.
    Returns: the initial number of bedbugs.
    """
    # L1
    final_bedbugs = 810 # After four days, there were 810 bedbugs
    growth_factor = 3 # Every day, the number of bedbugs would triple
    bedbugs_day_3 = final_bedbugs / growth_factor

    # L2
    bedbugs_day_2 = bedbugs_day_3 / growth_factor

    # L3
    initial_bedbugs = bedbugs_day_2 / growth_factor

    # FA
    answer = initial_bedbugs
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: On the third day, there were one-third of the number of bedbugs as the fourth day, so there were {final_bedbugs} / {growth_factor} = <<{final_bedbugs}/{growth_factor}={bedbugs_day_3}>>{bedbugs_day_3} bedbugs.
On the second day, there were one-third of the third day's bedbugs, so there were {bedbugs_day_3} / {growth_factor} = <<{bedbugs_day_3}/{growth_factor}={bedbugs_day_2}>>{bedbugs_day_2} bedbugs.
On the first day, there were {bedbugs_day_2} / {growth_factor} = <<{bedbugs_day_2}/{growth_factor}={initial_bedbugs}>>{initial_bedbugs} bedbugs in the group to start with.
